Title: The Exorcist
Description: When a teenage girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two priests to save her daughter.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: Meant to scare, startle, shock, and even repulse audiences.

Director.Name: William Friedkin
Director.Description: William 'Billy' Friedkin (born August 29, 1935) is an American film and television director, producer and screenwriter closely identified with the 'New Hollywood' movement of the 1970s. Beginning his career in documentaries in the early 1960s, he directed the crime thriller film The French Connection (1971), which won five Academy Awards, including Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay and Best Director, and the supernatural horror film The Exorcist (1973), which earned him a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Director.

Title: Silence of the Lambs
Description: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer.

Genre.Name: Crime
Genre.Description: A story that is centered around the solving of a crime.

Director.Name: Jonathan Demme
Director.Bio: Robert Jonathan Demme (February 22, 1944 to April 26, 2017) was an American filmmaker. Beginning his career under B-movie producer Roger Corman, Demme made his directorial debut with the 1974 women-in-prison film Caged Heat, before becoming known for his casually humanist films such as Melvin and Howard (1980), Swing Shift (1984), Something Wild (1986), and Married to the Mob (1988). His direction of the 1991 psychological horror film The Silence of the Lambs (1991) won him the Academy Award for Best Director. His subsequent films earned similar acclaim, notably Philadelphia (1993) and Rachel Getting Married (2008).

Title: The Sixth Sense
Description: Malcom Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thrillers tend to be action-packed and fast-paced with moments full of tension, anxiety, and fear.

Director.Name: M. Night Shyamalan
Director.Bio: Manoj Nelliyattu 'M. Night' Shyamalan (born August 6, 1970) is an Indian-born American filmmaker and actor. He is best known for making original films with contemporary supernatural plots and twist endings. He was born in Mahé, India, and raised in Penn Valley, Pennsylvania. The cumulative gross of his films exceeds $3.4 billion globally. His early films include Praying with Anger (1992) and Wide Awake (1998) before his breakthrough film The Sixth Sense (1999), which earned him Academy Award nominations for Best Director and Best Original Screenplay. He then released Unbreakable (2000), Signs (2002) and The Village (2004). Following a period of setbacks which include several poorly received films like The Happening (2008), The Last Airbender (2010), and After Earth (2013), he found a career resurgence with the films The Visit (2015), Split (2016), Glass (2019), Old (2021), and Knock at the Cabin (2023).

Title: Saw
Description: Two strangers awaken in a room with no recollection of how they got there, and soon discover they're pawns in a deadly game perpetrated by a notorious serial killer.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: Meant to scare, startle, shock, and even repulse audiences.

Director.Name: James Wan
Director.Bio: James Wan (born 26 February 1977) is an Australian filmmaker. He has primarily worked in the horror genre as the co-creator of the Saw and Insidious franchises and the creator of The Conjuring Universe. The lattermost is the highest-grossing horror franchise, at over $2 billion. Wan is also the founder of film and television production company Atomic Monster Productions.

Title: The Shining
Description: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

Genre.Name: Drama
Genre.Description: Strongly based in a character, or characters, that are in conflict at a crucial moment in their lives.

Director.Name: Stanley Kubrick
Director.Bio: Stanley Kubrick (July 26, 1928 to March 7, 1999) was an American film director, producer and screenwriter. Widely considered one of the greatest filmmakers of all time, his films—almost all of which are adaptations of novels or short stories—cover a wide range of genres and feature innovative cinematography, dark humor, realistic attention to detail and extensive set designs.

Title: The Conjuring
Description: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: Meant to scare, startle, shock, and even repulse audiences.

Director.Name: James Wan
Director.Bio: James Wan (born 26 February 1977) is an Australian filmmaker. He has primarily worked in the horror genre as the co-creator of the Saw and Insidious franchises and the creator of The Conjuring Universe. The lattermost is the highest-grossing horror franchise, at over $2 billion. Wan is also the founder of film and television production company Atomic Monster Productions.

Title: Poltergeist
Description: A family's home is haunter by a host of demonic ghosts.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: Meant to scare, startle, shock, and even repulse audiences.

Director.Name: Tobe Hooper
Director.Description: Willard Tobe Hooper (January 25, 1943 to August 26, 2017) was an American director, screenwriter, and producer best known for his work in the horror genre. The British Film Institute cited Hooper as one of the most influential horror filmmakers of all time.

Title: Insidious
Description: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child ina  realm called The Further.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thrillers tend to be action-packed and fast-paced with moments full of tension, anxiety, and fear.

Director.Name: James Wan
Director.Description: James Wan (born 26 February 1977) is an Australian filmmaker. He has primarily worked in the horror genre as the co-creator of the Saw and Insidious franchises and the creator of The Conjuring Universe. The lattermost is the highest-grossing horror franchise, at over $2 billion. Wan is also the founder of film and television production company Atomic Monster Productions.
Director.Bio: James Wan (born 26 February 1977) is an Australian filmmaker. He has primarily worked in the horror genre as the co-creator of the Saw and Insidious franchises and the creator of The Conjuring Universe. The lattermost is the highest-grossing horror franchise, at over $2 billion. Wan is also the founder of film and television production company Atomic Monster Productions.

Title: Annabelle
Description: A couple begins to experience terrifying supernatural occurrences involving a vintage doll shorlt after their home is invaded by satanic cultists.

Genre.Name: Horror
Genre.Description: Meant to scare, startle, shock, and even repulse audiences.

Director.Name: John Leonetti
Director.Bio: John Robert Leonetti, (born July 4, 1956) is an American cinematographer and film director. He is known for his collaborative work with director James Wan, with whom he has acted as cinematographer on five films.

Title: The Nun
Description: A preist with a haunted past and a novce on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate the death of a young nun in Romania and confront a malevolent force in the form of a demoic nun.

Genre.Name: Thriller
Genre.Description: Thrillers tend to be action-packed and fast-paced with moments full of tension, anxiety, and fear.

Director.Name: Corin Hardy
Director.Bio: Corin Hardy (born 6 January 1975) is an English film director. He made his directorial debut with the 2015 horror film The Hallow, which he also co-wrote. He directed the 2018 horror film The Nun, a spin-off of The Conjuring 2 (2016) and the fifth film in The Conjuring Universe.
